_field_struct.name: dof
_field_struct._field_explanation: We do not apply any blur past the focus distance. We use two different depth of fields: one for the world and one for the first person weapon.

_field_real.name: world blur aperture#Aperture is size of camera pinhole. The larger the aperture the shallower the depth of field. 0 defaults to 0.7
world blur focus max distance:wu#Maximum allowable focus distance (everything past the focus distance is always in focus anyway)

_field_real_fraction.name: World blur focus smoothing value: 0-1# 1 is unsmoothed, lower values are heavier smoothing
World blur trend smoothing value: 0-1# 1 is unsmoothed, lower values are heavier smoothing
world blur half width ratio:0-1#The wider the half width, the bigger the range of distances that are in focus

_field_real.name: weapon blur aperture#Aperture is size of camera pinhole. The larger the aperture the narrower the depth of field. 0 defaults to 0.7
weapon blur focus distance:wu#where dof focus is for the weapon (dof for weapon different than world)
weapon blur half width:wu#wider the width, the bigger the range of distances that are in focus (dof for weapon different than world)

_field_fraction_bounds.name: vignette radius bounds:0-1#Everything inside the min radius is clear, everything outside the max radius is fully darkened (to the intensity specified), interpolate between them

_field_real_fraction.name: vignette intensity:0-1#0 is no vignetting 1 maximum darkness
